Pre-Game Insights: The Pacers have won three in a row since the calendar flipped to 2025 and the team holds a winning record for the first time since winning the season opener.
The Bulls have won four of their last five games, including Monday’s comeback home win over the San Antonio Spurs.
Mathurin has recorded double-figure scoring in eight straight games.
White helped ice the game with a dunk over 7-foot-3 reigning All-Defensive first-teamer Victor Wembanyama, not a feat many have accomplished.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pacers will face the Chicago Bulls on Wednesday in Indianapolis.
The Bulls will look to avenge their 132-123 home loss to the Pacers on Dec. 6, in which Haliburton led six Pacers in double figures with 23 points.
LaVine put up 32 points in that game.
Others: Tyrese Haliburton’s 23 points followed by Bennedict Mathurin’s 20 and Pascal Siakam’s 19 helped guide the Pacers to their third straight double-digit win.
Mathurin, whose 16.7 points per game match a career-best, has shooting a career-high 46.6 percent from the field in 37 contests this season.
LaVine paces the team with 23.1 points per game, while Nikola Vucevic adds 20.5 and White follows with 18.5.
Coach Rick Carlisle praised Mathurin’s playing style, saying 'This is a winning brand of basketball that (Bennedict) is playing now.'
